intro: Cistanthera holtzii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep roots that help it access water. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Cistanthera holtzii is often found in sandy soils and is a component of the local flora in its native habitat.
